clinical_study.brief_title: The Effectiveness of Resistance Training on Glycemic Control for Patients With Type 2 Diabetes in Cardiac Rehabilitation
clinical_study.official_title: The Effectiveness of Resistance Training on Glycemic Control for Patients With Type 2 Diabetes in Cardiac Rehabilitation

lead_sponsor.agency: New York University School of Medicine

clinical_study.source: New York University School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: This study is designed to investigate the effect of a structured resistance training program on glycemic control, measured by hemoglobin A1c (glycated hemoglobin), in patients with type 2 diabetes (T2DM) who are enrolled in outpatient cardiac rehabilitation. The investigator will compare the experimental group receiving resistance training to a control group made of patients enrolled in outpatient cardiac rehabilitation and perform 3 aerobic exercise modalities during their sessions, which is the current standard of care.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of Stress measured by change in heart rate
Leg strength measured by assessing maximum weight subject can press one time on a leg press machine
Paired T-test to compare test-retest Perceived exertion
Paired T-test to compare test-retest Perceived dyspnea

arm_group.description: Participants will perform 3 exercises, one of which will be a series of 7 muscle-strengthening exercises using body weight resistance and elastic resistance bands + 36 sessions of a standard cardiac rehabilitation program consisting of monitored exercise, nutritional guidance, and heart-healthy lifestyle education three times weekly.

Participants will perform 3 exercises that do not include the 7 muscle-strengthening exercises + 36 sessions of a standard cardiac rehabilitation program consisting of monitored exercise, nutritional guidance, and heart-healthy lifestyle education three times weekly.

intervention.description: 7 muscle-strengthening exercises using body weight resistance and elastic resistance bands
3 exercises that do not include these 7 muscle-strengthening exercises

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis with T2DM and have been accepted for a standard outpatient cardiac rehabilitation program
- Cognitively able to comprehend the information presented in the program
- Cognitively able to give informed consent to participate in this study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with orthopedic or neurological limitations that would prevent them from participating in the resistance training program or monitored exercise sessions.
